Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix crawl.log: planned changes
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281

Comments below.

Gordon Mohr wrote:

>The following changes are planned for the current Heritrix 'crawl.log':
>
>(1) Split log into crawled.log (successes) and uncrawled.log (URIs
>     ineligible or unable to be crawled).
>
>     For the independent, episodic crawls we've been doing, a URI
>     would only appear in one log or the other -- never both.
>     (If/when we do continuous crawling, URIs might appear in both.)
>
>     This change should make it easier to focus on problems.
>  
>

Sounds good. 

Why the multiple spaces between fields?  Makes logs ~30% bigger than 
then need to be.|
|

>(2) Add a "deferred.log" which would capture problems that have
>     not yet resulted in success or failure -- for example,
>     a failure-to-connect that still has several retries left.
>
>     Currently, we don't necessarily see these until the CrawlURI
>     eventually succeeds or fails.
>
>     This log could be turned off. URIs could appear in this log
>     multiple times, and would also eventually appear in the
>     'crawled' or 'uncrawled' logs as well.
>  
>
Sounds good.

>(3) Change not-fetched statuses from cryptic negative numbers to
>     text abbrieviations. Here are the proposed new abbrieviations.
>
>     Current New       Explanation
>      0      -         Unattempted
>     -1      E_NoDns   Domain Unresolvable
>     -2      E_NoConn  Connection Failed
>     -3      E_LostCo  Lost Connection
>     -4      E_SoTime  Socket Timeout
>     -5      E_JRtExc  Java RuntimeException
>     -6      E_Prereq  Prerequisite Unavailable
>     -7      E_BadUri  Unfetchable URI
>     -8      E_Retrys  Too Many Retries
>     -3000   E_JError  Java 'Error': Out of Memory or Stack Overflow
>     -50     D_Defer   Deferred (for now)
>     -9998   D_Robots  Disregarded due to Robots Directives
>     -4000   D_Chaff   Disregarded; considered chaff (infinite junk)
>     -4001   D_Links   Disregarded: Too Many Link Hops
>     -4002   D_Embed   Disregarded: Too Many Embed Hops
>     -5000   D_Scope   Disregarded: Out of Scope
>
>(Some of these statuses may no longer be used, or may only appear
>whn something has gone seriously wrong with normal URI processing.)
>
>  
>

You make the result codes negative to distingush from the HTTP status 
code returned?  Otherwise I'd suggest reusing them (E.g: 408 Request 
Timeout  instead of  "-4 E_SoTime Socket Timeout").  Otherwise,  +1.


>(4) Add a flexible 'annotation' field way off to the right, so that
>     other notable conditions can be tagged on.
>
>     For example, when we give up because a document takes too long
>     or is too long, it's still a "200 OK" and a successful fetch,
>     but we must mark that it's truncated somewhere.
>
>     This will be the last field of the crawled/uncrawled/deferred
>     log, and consiste of a comma-separated list of tokens accumulated
>     from multiple previous Processor instances.
>
>     For example,
>
>       2t,sizeTrunc,noarchive
>
>     ...might indicate that 2 tries were necessary before success, the
>     resource was truncated as exceeding size limits, and a 'noarchive'
>     directive was discovered by the HTML extractor.
>
>(5) Reordering & reformatting of line contents. The "second line" of
>     hops-to and 'via URI' information will be folded into a single line.
>     Fields will be reordered to place the most important info to the left
>     and adjacent. Field order will be:
>
>[timestamp] [len] [status] [URI] [mime] [thread-no] [fetch-time] [path-to] [via-URI] [annotations]
>
>Any suggestions before this is enacted?
>
>  
>
All sounds good.

Do we have any reporting tools to go against our logs?

St.Ack

>- Gordon
